text: The ground suddenly trembles as a beast covered in rocky armor bursts from the earth. Its eyes glow green, and its roar echoes through the forest.
I instinctively step back, but my foot slips on a patch of slick moss. Before I can react, the beast lunges, its claws slicing through the air.
A surge of pain shoots up my arm. I grunt as blood seeps through my sleeve. The beast’s scorching breath bears down on me, nearly forcing me to the ground.
In that instant, a rush of wind slices through the air. Alicia leaps in from the right, her cloak flaring as she kicks the beast’s jaw and draws her blade in one smooth motion.
A flash of silver—her sword arcs precisely across the creature’s neck.
The beast lets out one final roar before crashing to the ground. Dust rises, and sparks flicker along the blade.
The air fills with the smell of scorched earth and blood. Alicia sheaths her sword and strides over, kneeling to inspect my wound.
She tears a strip from her cloak and quickly binds my arm. The firelight reflects on her face, and for the first time, I notice a softness beneath her usual composure.
“This kind of beast isn’t natural… it’s a ‘Lingering Dream.’”
“Lingering Dream?” I repeat, my voice still trembling.
“Yes. In places where battles were fought and people died, their final emotions sink into the earth. Over time, they take shape as things like this.”
Her tone is gentle, yet edged with cold certainty.
“Don’t worry too much. This forest is still far from the town center.”
I nod. She helps me to my feet and lets me lean against her for a moment. Once she’s sure I can stand steadily, her tone lightens again.
“Good.” She looks toward the sunlight beyond the trees, a faint smile curving her lips. “The market’s just ahead. The weather’s quite nice today.”
